item.title: Glencore Approaches Teck Over Its Coal Business
item.description: The commodities giant is willing to buy Teck’s unit as an alternative to a full merger.

item.title: Oil Slips as Investors Await US Rate Decision
item.description: Oil futures were close to 1.5% lower in Europe, with concerns about the economic outlook driving prices down and as investors, for now, ignoring signs of a sharply tightening market.

item.title: Sterling Vulnerable as UK Rate Rise Bets Could Be Revised Lower
item.description: Sterling could be exposed to a potential scaling back of the market’s interest rate rise expectations for the BOE, if upcoming U.K. wage and inflation data are weaker, ING said.

item.title: Georg Fischer Makes Bid for Finland's Uponor
item.description: Industrial supplier Georg Fischer has made an all-share offer to buy peer Uponor for €2.1 billion as it looks to boost its water- and flow-solutions business.

item.title: Autoliv Confirms 2023 Outlook, Other Targets
item.description: Autoliv said it still expects to report organic sales growth of around 15% and an adjusted operating margin of around 8.5%-9.% this year, and reiterated its medium- and long-term financial targets.

item.title: Ten-Year Italian BTP-German Bund Yield Spread Seen at Fair Level
item.description: Eurozone government bond yield spreads may continue tightening, but the 10-year Italian BTP-German Bund spread is at fair levels, BofA Global Research said.

item.title: Novo Nordisk To Boost Output Capability
item.description: Novo Nordisk said it plans to invest $2.3 billion to expand a pharmaceutical ingredient production facility in Denmark for its future portfolio within serious chronic diseases.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.5% as Investors Await Economic Data, Rate Decisions
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei closed up 0.5%, as investors awaited major economic data and central bank decisions this week.

item.title: Aluminum Prices Likely to Stay Under Pressure
item.description: Aluminum is likely to remain under pressure, SDIC Essence Futures said, expecting supply excess to emerge in the third quarter, which could pose a downside risk for prices.

item.title: Novartis to Buy U.S.-Based Chinook
item.description: Novartis has agreed to acquire Chinook Therapeutics for up to $3.5 billion, in a deal that will expand its portfolio of kidney disease treatments.

item.title: The Smart Way to Coast at Work
item.description: Sometimes, it’s not the moment to climb. That doesn’t mean you’ve stalled.

item.title: Wall Street Firms Up Bets on U.S. Consumers
item.description: Rising interest rates and inflation have barely dented most borrowers’ bill payments.

item.title: The Smart Way to Coast at Work
item.description: Sometimes, it’s not the moment to climb. That doesn’t mean you have to feel like you’ve stalled.

item.title: Glencore approached Teck about buying its coal assets, according to people familiar with the matter, providing an alternative to Glencore's proposal for a merger of the two mining companies.
item.description: Glencore approached Teck about buying its coal assets, according to people familiar with the matter, providing an alternative to Glencore’s proposal for a merger of the two mining companies.

item.title: Police arrested Scotland's former leader Nicola Sturgeon as part of a probe into her party's finances, the latest twist in a scandal that hasundermined the Scottish independence movement.
item.description: Police arrested Scotland’s former leader Nicola Sturgeon as part of a probe into her party’s finances, the latest twist in a scandal that has undermined the Scottish independence movement.

item.title: Francis deSouza resigned as Illumina's chief executive after he lost support from some board members following his pursuit of a $7 billion deal that was rejected by antitrust regulators and triggered a proxy battle with Carl Icahn.
item.description: Francis deSouza resigned as Illumina’s chief executive after he lost support from some board members following his pursuit of a $7 billion deal that was rejected by antitrust regulators and triggered a proxy battle with Carl Icahn.

item.title: A first-of-its-kind climate trial is set to begin in Montana, where a judge will determine whether the state's constitution obliges public officials to do more to address global warming.
item.description: A first-of-its-kind climate trial is set to begin in Montana, where a judge will determine whether the state’s constitution obliges public officials to do more to address global warming.

item.title: Moscow police arrested an American musician living in Russia on drug charges that could carry a sentence of up to 12 years in prison, Russian news services reported.
item.description: Moscow police arrested an American musician living in Russia on drug charges that could carry a sentence of up to 12 years in prison, Russian news services reported.

item.title: Church officials' response to sexual abuse and the question of whether women can be pastors will take center stage at the Southern Baptist Convention's annual meeting in New Orleans this week.
item.description: Church officials’ response to sexual abuse and the question of whether women can be pastors will take center stage at the Southern Baptist Convention’s annual meeting in New Orleans this week.

item.title: George Soros, the legendary investor, philanthropist and target of the right wing, is handing control of his $25 billion empire to a younger son, Alexander Soros, who wasn't thought to be a potential successor.
item.description: George Soros, the legendary investor, philanthropist and target of the right wing, is handing control of his $25 billion empire to a younger son, Alexander Soros, who wasn’t thought to be a potential successor.
